docs.snippet: LEAD: President Daniel Ortega Saavedra of Nicaragua said today that his Government was planning to advance the date for national and municipal elections by up to 10 months as a step toward greater democracy in Nicaragua....

docs.snippet: LEAD: The presidents of five Central American countries are to begin a regional summit meeting Monday that is described by their aides as a ''showdown'' with Nicaragua's Sandinista Government....

docs.snippet: LEAD: ANJELICA HUSTON PAUSED AND STUDIED a charcoal drawing of a woman in profile. The scene was the Metropolitan Museum of Art; the 37-year-old actress was taking an afternoon off from working on Woody Allen's latest movie to see the Degas show. ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ANJELICA HUSTON PAUSED AND STUDIED a charcoal drawing of a woman in profile. The scene was the Metropolitan Museum of Art; the 37-year-old actress was taking an afternoon off from working on Woody Allen's latest movie to see the Degas show. The drawing was of a handsome, dark-haired, strong-featured woman with a long, aristocratic nose.

headline.main: ANJELICA RISING: Stardom for Another Huston

byline.original: By James Kaplan; James Kaplan frequently writes about cultural subjects. His novel ''Pearl's Progress'' will be published by Alfred A. Knopf next month

docs.snippet: LEAD: A play called ''The Paper Gramophone'' opened to previews last night at the Hartford Stage Company and brought full circle a cultural union between the artistic director of the Hartford and an artistic director from Russia....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A play called ''The Paper Gramophone'' opened to previews last night at the Hartford Stage Company and brought full circle a cultural union between the artistic director of the Hartford and an artistic director from Russia.

headline.main: Sharing the Language of the Stage

docs.snippet: LEAD: IF Bugbee & Brownell seems familiar, it's because it is. The relatively new restaurant, on the Post Road in Darien (next to Friendly's, just off Exit 13 of Interstate 95), is actually the old Harper's and has simply changed its name. The new...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IF Bugbee & Brownell seems familiar, it's because it is. The relatively new restaurant, on the Post Road in Darien (next to Friendly's, just off Exit 13 of Interstate 95), is actually the old Harper's and has simply changed its name. The new name, inspired by an old Boston tea company which has no connection to the restaurant, is meant, in one waitress's words, ''to sound good, as part of our upscaling.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Officials from five Central American countries ended two days of talks here today still divided over steps to insure greater respect for democracy and human rights throughout the region....

headline.main: 5 Latin Lands End Talks Still Divided Over Rights

byline.original: By PAUL LEWIS, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Foreign Ministers of five Central American countries said tonight that they were moving ahead again with their long-stalled peace plan for the region after a day of talks with Secretary General Javier Perez de Cuellar....

headline.main: Central Americans Cite Progress in Reviving Arias Plan

byline.original: By PAUL LEWIS, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Lionel Newman, who composed, conducted or supervised the scores of more than 250 movies, including ''Hello, Dolly!'', for which he won an Academy Award, died of a heart attack Friday at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center. He was 73 years old. Mr. N...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Lionel Newman, who composed, conducted or supervised the scores of more than 250 movies, including ''Hello, Dolly!'', for which he won an Academy Award, died of a heart attack Friday at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center. He was 73 years old. Mr. Newman's 11 Oscar nominations included those for scoring the music of such films as ''Doctor Doolittle,'' ''Mardi Gras,'' ''Let's Make Love'' and ''The Pleasure Seekers.

headline.main: Lionel Newman, 73, Winner of an Oscar As a Film Composer

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Nicaraguan Foreign Minister said today that Central American countries appear ready to move ahead with their long-stalled regional peace plan. Officials from five nations are to meet Wednesday and Thursday at the United Nations....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Nicaraguan Foreign Minister said today that Central American countries appear ready to move ahead with their long-stalled regional peace plan. Officials from five nations are to meet Wednesday and Thursday at the United Nations.

headline.main: Nicaraguan Sees Revival of Arias Plan at U.N.

byline.original: By PAUL LEWIS, Special to the New York Times
